name: Basalt
description: Basalt is a dark, often grey or brown colored, volcanic rock. It is hard and can be porous.
occurrence: Found commonly across the world, especially on the floor of the ocean and volcanic islands. It can occur in a variety of formations from pillowy cooled lava flows to neatly structured hexagonal columns.

name: Diamond
description: A structurally perfect diamond is transparent with no hue, but diamonds can vary widely in color. In order of increasing rarity, diamond hues can be yellow, brown, colorless, blue, green, black, pink, orange, purple, and red. While they are chiefly sought after for use in jewelry due to their appearance, diamonds and diamond dust are also used as spell components.
occurrence: Diamonds move to the surface via igneous host rocks. They can be found by themselves deposited in sand and sediment near bodies of water that transported them, or embedded in volcanic rock.
component: Clone, Gate, Glyph of Warding, Greater Restoration, Nondetection, Raise Dead, Resurrection, Revivify, Sequester, Stoneskin, Symbol, True Resurrection

name: Emerald
description: Emerald is a green precious gemstone. Since emeralds commonly have cloudy inclusions, clear specimens are rare and valuable.
occurrence: Found in black shale beds or where shale and limestone are layered, as well as in granite deposits.

name: Granite
description: Granite is a speckled rock that typically contains grey, white, and sometimes slight reddish hues. It is formed from an array of crystals, primarily quartz and feldspar.
occurrence: Commonly found in huge deposits in mountains.

name: Limestone
description: Limestone is a somewhat soft rock that ranges in color from light grey to white.
occurrence: Found in large amounts in bodies of water and caves.

name: Marble
description: Marble commonly occurs as a white rock with plenty of impurities that give it a "marbled" appearance. It is soft, polishes well, and can have a glitzy appearance with a slight amount of translucence.
occurrence: Occurs commonly in old layers of the planet's crust, where tectonic plates converge and fold under high heat and pressure.

name: Ruby
description: A red or pink precious gemstone that can range from being transparent with a glassy luster to being very opaque and dull.
occurrence: Rubies can be found in marble and basalt.
component: Continual Flame, Forbiddance, Forcecage, Sequester, Simulacrum

name: Sandstone
description: Sandstone is a sedimentary rock that forms from heavily compacted and cemented sand. It is often tan or yellowish in color, but can also be found in grey, white, and black.
occurrence: Forms in areas that sand is deposited and buried, such as deserts and near bodies of water.

name: Sapphire
description: Sapphire is a precious gemstone typically blue in color, though they can occur in just about any other hue. The pink to reddish-pink range of hues that sapphires can have at times make some specimens difficult to distinguish from rubies, which can also lean towards a pinkish-red hue, but sapphires are never fully red in the way that many rubies are.
occurrence: Found in granite, gneiss, schist, and various other igneous and metamorphic rocks, as well as in alluvial deposits.
